column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The building itself is a work of art.  In my opinion the building design has an elegant modesty about it.  With its innovative sun shade system that allows gentle sunlight from the north
column2: yet shields work from the harsh southern sun light
column3: this canopy or "flying carpet" as it is called uses an estimated 50% less energy for light and heat than the existing portions of The Art Institute.  There are 3 levels to the new wing and each floor can provide full-length striking views of Millennium Park and the city beyond.
